title: Fuck you Riot and your bullshit nerf of Graves
body:
Yup its the MAGIC resist from True Grit, thats why hes such cancer.

How about you fucking clowns have some god damn integrity and stop leaving special champion in OP states?

Fuck off with your nerf. It won't do a god damn thing and you guys know it.  Your company literally makes me sick to my stomach sometimes with your fucktardation thinking that you display for us on a regular basis.

replies.body: Show me on the Doll where Graves clapped you
If you want recognition from Riot you should start with a well-worded post. Not this hate-spew. Nobody at Riot is going to read a post like this.
Shut your fucking face. They don't respond to random posts no matter how well worded. I learned that years ago.

> [{quoted}](name=DonnieDarkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=l7nvUNni,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-04-20T18:38:57.150+0000)
>
> Shut your fucking face. They don't respond to random posts no matter how well worded. I learned that years ago.

Then what is the point of posting? All you've achieved here is to make yourself look terrible in the eyes of others.

I'm not against you here, I think Graves is still a problem. But this isn't the way to go about anything.
I want more people to be as mad. Imagine if 50 percent of hte posts were like mine. You think they would ignore it? No. WE should harshly and not politely call them out on their bullshit.

Hah. No.

If you want somebody to listen to you, you would do best to not make them hate you first. The truth is that in order to get others to accomplish tasks for you, you must treat them with respect. If you behave childishly and bitchily then others will shut you out, ignore you, or downright sabotage you.

OK, example time.

If we were housemates and you were taller than me. Lets say there's a box of cereal we both like, you keep putting it up on the fridge out of my reach. So morning rolls around and I find that I can't get the cereal, but I need to eat breakfast and get going to work...

...Is it faster to yell at you about it and start an argument, or would it be faster to ask you to please get it for me? Which would be more likely to illicit your help for me and get me out the door to work fed and on time?

Lets examine the same behavior in the workplace. If 50% of the people in your department at work are bitching about a problem they want another department to fix, do you think the department that could fix it is going to want to? No. They will dig in their heels and fight back, and if they do fix the problem it will be begrudgingly and trust will be lost.

Now when _**anybody else**_  in your department has an issue and asks the other department for help, they will not feel motivated to help that person. Then you and your 50% of the department are indirectly responsible for making life harder for other people within your department.

This is exactly what you're doing to the boards and the other players who care about the same issues as you. People like you are the reason everybody complains about circlejerking on the boards. People like you are the reason nobody takes the boards seriously when feedback and suggestions are posted.

Riot doesnt treat their players with respect. Dont expect me or anyone to feel like they deserve any.

You don't seem to ge it. Over 3 years, I have seen nearly every polite post that is CRITICAL of Riot or a decision or a designer, not get real responses from Riot. If they are indeed reading them, then they lack the god damn common courtesy to acknowledge with a comment or at least show ups how many Rioters viewed our post.

So we fly blind when writing posts that we want Riot to see. And what do we get? We get gaffed off for a year by Riot when we all demanded solo queue back. We get lectured by them on why the new system was better. Finally they see things our way and bring it back.

I dont think they respect us, they see us as money and that is all. It takes a lot to get their attention.

Respect and Disrespect are two opposite ends of the spectrum. Not responding is somewhere in between, not full-tilt on the side of disrespect. Also I'm 95% certain it's company policy that they are not allowed to comment.

The thing is, Riot is a very large company, and they have even stated that politics plays a role in how quickly change occurs. When they took solo queue away there might have been plenty of Rioters who noticed and agreed with the player-base once the complaints started flowing in. It takes time enact change or reverse the flow of a decision made within a large organization.

That is probably part of the reason they don't comment on gameplay posts. Because they are individuals who have their own opinions and ideas, but we as a community would not see it that way. This could lead to a huge problem in miscommunications and misunderstandings.

But Riot is all about money. I am convinced that the game is kept unbalanced to drives sales and/or for job security, depending on what level of the company we are talking about. 

Or, because they are individuals with their own ideas, too many personal biases get invovled which creates balance issues or favored champions.

Or a little of all of that. Please Marc Merrills big stupid ego.

Cz this is like talking to a 10-year-old brat. No one will take you seriously anyway. You're probably so childish that if someone were to comment something which disagrees with your idea, you'd instantly call them trolls for apparently no reason at all.
I actually agree with that lol, but Graves does not feel that busted

Exactly, they won't look at "New" posts, but they do browse the "Hot" posts.

Just because they don't comment doesn't mean they don't see what is written. They take it all with a grain of salt, and they don't always listen because we are biased on the boards, and they may know better due to internal planning at Riot that we are not privy to.
I'm sure they will care about some whiny brat crying and cussing at them more.
You dont always get to ban.
